About This Game

All creatures of ancient myth, legend and lore are real  they've just been sealed away for thousands of years inside Pandora's Box, waiting...
When a thief named Deckard is hired to steal an ancient artifact, he unwittingly triggers a war between man and myth.
Griffons rule the skies, Werewolves tear the innocent limb from limb and cities are held under siege as creatures we'd dismissed as imaginings of our ancestors prove to be very real and very angry for being held prisoner for untold millennia.
As the only person able to return these creatures to the box, Deckard finds that he must work with a shadowy secret society to save civilization before it is torn apart by tooth and claw.
  • A mythical first person shooter set in an unprepared, modern world.
  • A massive blockbuster movie experience  society collapses around you as man and machine take on beasts of legend in spectacular battle.
  • Awe-inspiring fire-fights where high caliber ordinance meets beak, talon, fang and claw.
  • Dynamic environments crumble around you as you and your enemies tear a living, breathing environment apart in your battle to stay alive.
  • Devastation realized on an unprecedented scale. See London burn to the ground and witness New York torn apart through spectacular supernatural destruction.
  • The enemy of your enemy is your enemy  witness and take part in three way battles as you combat the supernatural as well as the militant arm of an age old clandestine organization who prove to be a formidable opponent and adequate prey for the armies of mythical beasts.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP SP2 or Windows Vista
    • Processor: 2.0+ GHZ Single Core Processor
    • Memory: 512MB of System RAM
    • Graphics: Nvidia 6200+ or ATI Radeon 9600+ Video Card
    • Hard Drive: 10GB of Free Hard Drive Space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows XP SP2 or Windows Vista
    • Processor: 2.4+ GHZ Dual Core Processor
    • Memory: 1GB of System RAM
    • Graphics: Nvidia 7800GTX+ or ATI x1300+ Video Card
    • Hard Drive: 10GB of Free Hard Drive Space

56 of 70 people (80%) found this review helpful

CrusadeR
152 products in account
7 reviews
Recommended
11.8 hrs on record
Posted: 31 December, 2014
I don't understand why this game's got such a bad rating. It's very old school similar to Doom, it's linear and you shoot everything that moves. The monsters are cool and the minotaurs can be hard to kill sometimes. I did not encounter any bugs except one, which I agree is game breaking. I took forumer ZanyCynic's advice below and was able to progress without any issues.

To fix the Elevator bug, Open the PandoraEngine.ini (on vista it is on C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config-Folder) and search for
"MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300" and change the value to 30. So the game runs at maximum 30 fps. Play through to next check point save then edit it back to 300 and continue game.

I got this for 99 cents and it's well worth it if you pick it up during a sale. I defnitely recommend playing it if you like old school games like Doom, Quake and Farcry 1.

Posted: 29 January
I don't understand why everybody hates this game. Sure, this is an ultra-linear FPS that almost plays like a railshooter, with mediocre graphics. I understand people that got mad by purchasing this game on full-price when it came out, but I got this game for two dollars, and it was totally worth it. It's a fun game, with a badass soundtrack, and the best intro that I have ever seen.

Luke 10:17-20
1,892 products in account
59 reviews
Recommended
7.1 hrs on record
Posted: 31 March
This game is better than most people say it is. I think it's a good thing this game got so much bad press, because you will go into it expecting crap, and you will be surprised by how not crap it is. Actually, you'll probably be amazed at all the scripted events and chaos and enemies lurking about. A griffon causing havoc, breaking into buildings and nearly taking your head off, another griffon flying through a cathedral... truly... this is some fantastic stuff for a game released in 2008. And it looks good too.

Also, Legendary touches upon a story that, when you see Pandora's Box as a symbol for genetic splicing, is all too realistic and believable. I think this scares the haters and they don't want to admit it, so while in fear they just hate.

For FPS games, this is pretty good. Granted, it's not the most engaging, but if you play the game with the mind that that awesome fireman's axe is your primary weapon and what you use for most of the game, believe me, this game all of a sudden becomes very engaging and worthwhile. The guns are pretty good, but there's something lacking in engaging enemies with them, but that axe... it's all about that axe and hunting werewolves with it. A good challenge is to face the first Minotaur with the axe. Grenades and molotovs are very welcome to use, but always weild that axe.

The enemies, not including the humans, are also really well done. The Nari are very well scripted and a real treat to witness and axe to death. They go around lifting things and throwing them at you. They appear in front of your face and do a little mockery dance. They lift soda machines and cause the soda cans to fly out at you. The Nari truly make this game really enjoyable. Of course, they are an enemy, but a very unique enemy. It's obvious a lot of love went into creating them.

Also, there's that game-breaking bug at the end, which solutions have been made available by players.

If this game ever got achievements, it would only need one. I challenge all you players to earn it:


Legendary - Beat the game weilding the fireman's axe for at least 80% of the game


This is how you make a decent game more fun. Enjoy.

Mashiro™
124 products in account
29 reviews
Recommended
0.7 hrs on record
Posted: 16 April
Love the introduction, great gameplay so far, graphics aren't the best but it's unique and I found it great for the best part of 40 minutes. Then I got to a part in the mission where I needed to get ontop of a platform, ended up improvising - after not knowing what to do - and dying to a wooden crate XD, nethertheless I will watch a way around it and to progress onto the next checkpoint. So far I loved it, I do recommend it, especially for monster lovers - demons, flying monsters, FPS, firey, all the rest of it.
Wish the introduction let me shoot civilians as it would've kept me entertained as I walked around the vents etc, but then again I suppose I am trying to find a way around the hell-ish world! Anyways, a yes from me, enjoyed it, and I will definitely play it again ^>_<^
